Description: Rim and body sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style black-figured pottery bowl; white slip; interior: streaky black (fired mostly red) with reserved band near lip; black on top of rim; exterior: black-figure animal frieze depicting possible lion to left (rump, tail, and right hind leg remaining); pinwheel rosettes, dashes, and dots as filling ornament; below, black band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.319)
